H0.text: A low pH level is the condition that makes topsoil most fertile.

H1.text: Low sand content is what makes topsoil most fertile.

H2.text: A high organic matter level is what makes topsoil most fertile.

H3.text: A high parent rock material level is what makes topsoil considered most fertile.

A4.text: Organic matter provides nutrition for living organisms and varies in quantity between different soils; more organic matter increases the strength of the soil structure.

A5.text: Bacteria and fungi can be essential in facilitating nutrient exchange with plants and in breaking down organic matter into a form that roots can absorb.
